title: Matthew Chapter 8 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 8 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 8 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 8.

questions.question: Who came to Jesus and worshipped him, saying, 'Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean'?
options: A leper
A centurion
A scribe
Peter's wife's mother
questions.correctAnswer: A leper
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:2 states that a leper came and worshipped Jesus, asking to be made clean.

questions.question: What did Jesus do to the leper to make him clean?
options: Spoke a word
Put forth his hand and touched him
Gave him water to drink
Prayed over him
questions.correctAnswer: Put forth his hand and touched him
questions.explanation: According to Matthew 8:3, Jesus put forth his hand and touched the leper, saying, 'I will; be thou clean.'

questions.question: What did Jesus tell the healed leper to do after being cleansed?
options: Tell everyone immediately
Go to the priest and offer the gift Moses commanded
Follow Jesus
Stay in the city
questions.correctAnswer: Go to the priest and offer the gift Moses commanded
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:4 instructs the healed leper to show himself to the priest and offer the gift as commanded by Moses.

questions.question: Who came to Jesus in Capernaum, asking for healing for his servant?
options: A centurion
A Pharisee
A tax collector
A scribe
questions.correctAnswer: A centurion
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:5 tells us that a centurion came to Jesus in Capernaum beseeching him.

questions.question: What did the centurion say about Jesus coming under his roof?
options: He welcomed Jesus gladly
He said he was not worthy for Jesus to come under his roof
He insisted Jesus must come
He said it was necessary for the healing
questions.correctAnswer: He said he was not worthy for Jesus to come under his roof
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:8, the centurion humbly says he is not worthy for Jesus to come under his roof but only to speak the word.

questions.question: Why did the centurion believe Jesus could heal his servant by just speaking a word?
options: Because Jesus was a prophet
Because he had authority over illness
Because he understood authority and command
Because he saw a miracle before
questions.correctAnswer: Because he understood authority and command
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:9 explains the centurion’s understanding of authority, comparing it to his command over soldiers.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the centurion's faith?
options: It was the greatest faith he had found in Israel
It was weak
It was common among the people
It needed improvement
questions.correctAnswer: It was the greatest faith he had found in Israel
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:10, Jesus marvels and says he has not found so great faith in Israel.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say would come from the east and west to sit with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven?
options: Many
Only the Jews
The disciples
The Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: Many
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:11 states that many shall come from east and west to sit with the patriarchs in heaven's kingdom.

questions.question: What will happen to the children of the kingdom, according to Jesus?
options: They will be blessed
They shall be cast out into outer darkness
They shall inherit the earth
They shall be healed
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be cast out into outer darkness
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:12 warns that the children of the kingdom will be cast into outer darkness with weeping and gnashing of teeth.

questions.question: What happened to the centurion's servant after Jesus spoke the word?
options: He was healed immediately
He remained sick
He was healed after a week
He died
questions.correctAnswer: He was healed immediately
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:13 confirms the servant was healed in the same hour as Jesus spoke.

questions.question: Whose house did Jesus enter where he healed a sick woman with a fever?
options: Peter's house
John's house
The centurion's house
A scribe's house
questions.correctAnswer: Peter's house
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:14 states Jesus came into Peter's house and healed his wife's mother from a fever.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus healed many possessed with devils by casting out the spirits with his word.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:16 records that Jesus cast out spirits with his word and healed all who were sick.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told a scribe that the Son of man has many places to rest his head.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:20 states that the Son of man has not where to lay his head, unlike foxes and birds.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus calmed the storm after his disciples woke him up because they were afraid.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:24-26 describes a great tempest and Jesus calming the storm after being awakened.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Matthew 8:26: 'Why are ye fearful, O ye of little ______?'
options: faith
hope
love
strength
questions.correctAnswer: faith
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:26 shows Jesus rebuking his disciples for their fear and little faith during the storm.

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 8 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 8 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about God's power to heal. Based on Matthew 8, what biblical truth would you share about faith and healing?
options: Great faith can bring about healing even from a distance
Healing is only for those who are physically close to Jesus
Faith must be proven by works before healing occurs
Only priests can declare someone clean after healing
questions.correctAnswer: Great faith can bring about healing even from a distance
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:8-10 and 13, the centurion expresses great faith that Jesus can heal his servant just by speaking the word, without being physically present. Jesus marvels at this faith and heals the servant immediately, showing that trust in God's power is key to healing.

questions.question: How does Matthew 8 teach us about humility when approaching God?
options: The centurion acknowledges his unworthiness for Jesus to enter his home
The leper demands to be healed without respect
The scribe boasts about his willingness to follow Jesus
The disciples claim they deserve special treatment
questions.correctAnswer: The centurion acknowledges his unworthiness for Jesus to enter his home
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:8 shows the centurion saying, 'Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof,' demonstrating humility in approaching Jesus. This attitude highlights that faith combined with humility is honored.

questions.question: What does Matthew 8 teach about obedience to God's commands through the story of the healed leper?
options: The healed leper is instructed to show himself to the priest and offer the commanded gift
The leper is told to keep silent and never tell anyone
The leper must repay Jesus with money
The leper is told to leave the community immediately
questions.correctAnswer: The healed leper is instructed to show himself to the priest and offer the commanded gift
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:4 instructs the healed leper to obey the Law of Moses by showing himself to the priest and offering the gift as a testimony. This teaches that spiritual obedience and following God's ordinances are essential even after receiving blessings.

questions.question: A believer is fearful during a difficult trial and questions God's care. How does Matthew 8 guide us in trusting God during storms?
options: Jesus rebukes fear and calms the storm, showing the importance of faith
We should avoid all trials to stay safe
God only helps if we are perfect in faith
Trials prove God has abandoned us
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus rebukes fear and calms the storm, showing the importance of faith
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:23-26 describes Jesus calming the storm after rebuking his disciples for their little faith. This passage teaches believers to trust God’s power and presence even in life’s storms rather than giving in to fear.

questions.question: How does Matthew 8 illustrate the principle of spiritual authority and submission?
options: The centurion explains his authority over soldiers parallels Jesus' authority over sickness
Disciples argue about who is the greatest
Jesus demands that all must bow only to him physically
The leper refuses to submit to Jesus' touch
questions.correctAnswer: The centurion explains his authority over soldiers parallels Jesus' authority over sickness
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:9, the centurion compares his command over soldiers to Jesus’ authority to heal by a word, teaching that recognizing and submitting to God’s authority is vital in faith and obedience.

questions.question: What biblical truth about discipleship and priorities does Jesus teach in Matthew 8?
options: Following Jesus requires immediate and wholehearted commitment, even above family duties
Jesus allows disciples to delay following him for personal matters
Family obligations are more important than following Jesus
Discipleship is optional and can be postponed indefinitely
questions.correctAnswer: Following Jesus requires immediate and wholehearted commitment, even above family duties
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:21-22 shows Jesus telling a disciple to 'Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead,' emphasizing that commitment to Christ takes precedence over familial or social obligations.

questions.question: How does Matthew 8 teach about Jesus' compassion and service to families?
options: Jesus heals Peter's mother-in-law and she serves them afterward
Jesus ignores requests for healing within families
Jesus teaches that family members must be perfect before healing
Jesus avoids family settings to focus on crowds
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus heals Peter's mother-in-law and she serves them afterward
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:14-15, Jesus heals Peter's mother-in-law and she immediately ministers to them, illustrating how Jesus' compassion restores families and inspires service.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 8, Jesus performed miracles at evening after healing many during the day.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:16 states that at evening many possessed with devils were brought to Jesus and he healed all who were sick, showing his continuous ministry of healing.

questions.question: True or False: The people of the city rejoiced and welcomed Jesus to stay after he cast out the demons into the swine.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:34 records that the whole city came out and begged Jesus to depart from their coasts after the incident, showing their fear and rejection rather than joy.

questions.question: A believer is wondering how faith affects their standing in God's kingdom. What does Matthew 8 teach about faith and inclusion in the kingdom of heaven?
options: Many from east and west will join the patriarchs in the kingdom, showing inclusive faith
Only those born in Israel will enter the kingdom
Faith is not necessary to enter the kingdom
The kingdom is limited to priests and rulers
questions.correctAnswer: Many from east and west will join the patriarchs in the kingdom, showing inclusive faith
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:11 teaches that many from different regions will sit with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven, emphasizing that faith opens the way for all believers.

questions.question: Which lesson about perseverance through spiritual trials is shown by Jesus’ interaction with the two possessed men in Matthew 8?
options: Jesus demonstrates authority over evil spirits and brings deliverance
Spiritual battles must be fought alone without help
Possession is permanent and cannot be overcome
Jesus avoids confronting evil spirits
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus demonstrates authority over evil spirits and brings deliverance
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:28-32 shows Jesus casting out demons from two possessed men, illustrating His power to deliver from spiritual bondage and encouraging believers to trust Him in spiritual trials.

questions.question: How does Matthew 8 teach about trusting God's timing and provision when Jesus says, 'The Son of man hath not where to lay his head'?
options: Following Jesus requires faith in God's provision despite worldly lack of security
Jesus promises material wealth to all disciples
Comfort is the first sign of true discipleship
Physical rest is a guarantee for believers
questions.correctAnswer: Following Jesus requires faith in God's provision despite worldly lack of security
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:20 reveals Jesus’ statement about having no place to rest, teaching that true discipleship involves trusting God’s provision and being content without earthly security.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Matthew 8, Jesus said, 'Why are ye fearful, O ye of ______ faith?'
options: little
great
strong
no
questions.correctAnswer: little
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:26, Jesus rebukes the disciples saying, 'Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith?' emphasizing the need for strong trust in God.

questions.question: How does Matthew 8 guide believers about generosity and stewardship through the centurion’s example?
options: The centurion’s faith shows trust in God's authority rather than reliance on wealth or power
The centurion bribes Jesus for healing
Generosity is required before receiving blessings
Stewardship is only about managing money
questions.correctAnswer: The centurion’s faith shows trust in God's authority rather than reliance on wealth or power
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:5-9 reveals the centurion’s humble faith in Jesus’ word rather than his own status or resources, teaching believers to trust God’s authority above material means.

questions.question: What does Matthew 8 teach about prayer and Jesus' response to urgent needs?
options: Jesus responds immediately to the centurion’s faith-filled request by healing his servant
Prayer must be repeated many times for effectiveness
Jesus delays healing until the person is present
Only public prayers are answered
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus responds immediately to the centurion’s faith-filled request by healing his servant
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:13 shows Jesus telling the centurion, 'as thou hast believed, so be it done unto thee,' and the servant is healed immediately, demonstrating the power of faith-filled prayer.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 8 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 8.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus telling the healed leper to show himself to the priest and offer the gift Moses commanded?
options: It fulfilled the Mosaic Law for ceremonial cleansing and witness
It was a test of the leper's obedience to Jesus
It symbolized Jesus' rejection of traditional Jewish customs
It was to publicly shame the healed man
questions.correctAnswer: It fulfilled the Mosaic Law for ceremonial cleansing and witness
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:4 instructs the healed leper to follow Mosaic Law commands, showing Jesus’ respect for the Law and providing testimony to the priests.

questions.question: How does the centurion's understanding of authority (Matthew 8:9) reflect Roman military structure and relate to Jesus' authority?
options: Authority is exercised by command and obedience, analogous to Jesus speaking a word to heal
Authority is based on lineage and heritage, similar to Jesus’ Davidic descent
Authority comes from wealth and social status, paralleling Jesus’ miracles
Authority is irrelevant, as faith alone is sufficient
questions.correctAnswer: Authority is exercised by command and obedience, analogous to Jesus speaking a word to heal
questions.explanation: The centurion exemplifies Roman command hierarchy, and he applies this concept to Jesus’ spiritual authority, believing Jesus’ word alone can heal (Matthew 8:9).

questions.question: Which Old Testament prophecy is fulfilled by Jesus healing the sick and casting out demons as noted in Matthew 8:17?
options: Isaiah's prophecy that He Himself took our infirmities and bore our sicknesses
Jeremiah's prophecy about the suffering servant
Psalm 23's depiction of the Lord as shepherd
Ezekiel's vision of the valley of dry bones
questions.correctAnswer: Isaiah's prophecy that He Himself took our infirmities and bore our sicknesses
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:17 explicitly quotes Isaiah to show Jesus’ healing works fulfill messianic prophecy of bearing human suffering.

questions.question: Why does Jesus say to the scribe, 'The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head' (Matthew 8:20)?
options: To emphasize the cost and lack of earthly security in following Him
To highlight the abundance of natural provisions for animals
To indicate the Son of Man’s preference for a nomadic lifestyle
To criticize the scribe for seeking comfort
questions.correctAnswer: To emphasize the cost and lack of earthly security in following Him
questions.explanation: Jesus uses this metaphor to teach about the sacrifices and hardships entailed in discipleship, stressing spiritual over material security (Matthew 8:20).

questions.question: What literary device is illustrated by Jesus calming the storm after being asleep, as recorded in Matthew 8:24-26?
options: Chiasm highlighting divine authority over chaos
Allegory of spiritual awakening
Parable illustrating faith in action
Foreshadowing of resurrection
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm highlighting divine authority over chaos
questions.explanation: The narrative structure places Jesus’ sleep and the storm’s fury in a chiastic pattern, emphasizing His sovereign power to command nature (Matthew 8:24-26).

questions.question: In Matthew 8:11-12, what theological theme is expressed by saying many will come from east and west to sit with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, while children of the kingdom will be cast out?
options: Inclusion of Gentiles and judgment on unfaithful Israelites
Restoration of Israel as a political nation
Exclusivity of salvation to Jews only
A call to ethnic purity
questions.correctAnswer: Inclusion of Gentiles and judgment on unfaithful Israelites
questions.explanation: Jesus predicts the kingdom will include Gentiles (east and west) and that some Jews (children of the kingdom) will face exclusion, indicating a shift in covenant community (Matthew 8:11-12).

questions.question: What cultural significance does the presence of swine in the narrative of Matthew 8:30-32 have?
options: Swine symbolize unclean animals forbidden to Jews, highlighting the Gentile region
Swine represent wealth and prosperity in Jewish society
Swine were sacred animals in Israelite worship
Swine were common pets in Jewish households
questions.correctAnswer: Swine symbolize unclean animals forbidden to Jews, highlighting the Gentile region
questions.explanation: The presence of swine, unclean to Jews, indicates Jesus is ministering in a Gentile area (Gergesenes), showing the expanding scope of His ministry (Matthew 8:30-32).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus’ healing of Peter’s mother-in-law by touching her hand (Matthew 8:14-15) demonstrates a physical contact element in His miracles.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus healed Peter’s mother-in-law by touching her hand, showing that physical contact was part of His healing method (Matthew 8:14-15).

questions.question: How does the faith of the centurion (Matthew 8:10) serve as a typological contrast to typical Israelite faith expectations?
options: His faith trusts Jesus’ word without physical presence, surpassing Israelite expectations
His faith depends on signs and wonders like Israel
His faith is rooted in Jewish law observance
His faith is limited, requiring Jesus to come personally
questions.correctAnswer: His faith trusts Jesus’ word without physical presence, surpassing Israelite expectations
questions.explanation: Jesus marvels at the centurion’s faith, which trusts the spoken word alone, unlike many Israelites who sought physical proof (Matthew 8:10).

questions.question: What is the meaning of Jesus’ statement to the disciple who wanted to bury his father first: 'Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead' (Matthew 8:22)?
options: A call to prioritize spiritual life over traditional family obligations
An instruction to neglect burial rites
A command to abandon all family responsibilities permanently
An indication that burial is unnecessary
questions.correctAnswer: A call to prioritize spiritual life over traditional family obligations
questions.explanation: Jesus emphasizes immediate discipleship and spiritual commitment over customary family duties, reflecting the radical demands of following Him (Matthew 8:22).

questions.question: What does the phrase 'Let the dead bury their dead' in Matthew 8:22 allude to in a broader biblical or Jewish cultural context?
options: A contrast between physical death and spiritual death
A literal command to leave corpses unburied
A reference to the Exodus burial practices
A common Jewish proverb about mourning
questions.correctAnswer: A contrast between physical death and spiritual death
questions.explanation: The phrase highlights the distinction between those spiritually alive in Christ and those who are spiritually dead, a theme echoed in prophetic literature.

questions.question: Which theme in Matthew 8 is foreshadowed by Jesus’ command to depart to the other side of the lake when great multitudes gather (Matthew 8:18)?
options: The pattern of Jesus’ ministry including withdrawal and private teaching
The failure of the crowds to recognize Jesus as Messiah
Jesus’ rejection by His hometown
His forthcoming crucifixion
questions.correctAnswer: The pattern of Jesus’ ministry including withdrawal and private teaching
questions.explanation: Jesus often withdrew from crowds to teach privately or prepare for the next phase of ministry, showing deliberate authorial planning (Matthew 8:18).

questions.question: What does the reaction of the men who witnessed Jesus rebuke the winds and sea (Matthew 8:27) reveal about the early perception of Jesus’ identity?
options: Amazement and questioning of His divine authority over nature
Fear and rejection of His teachings
Recognition of Him as a political messiah
Confusion about His origins
questions.correctAnswer: Amazement and questioning of His divine authority over nature
questions.explanation: The men marvel and ask what kind of man can command nature, highlighting recognition of Jesus’ extraordinary, possibly divine power (Matthew 8:27).

questions.question: What is the historical significance of Jesus performing miracles such as healing leprosy and palsy in the context of Second Temple Judaism?
options: Miracles authenticate Jesus as the promised Messiah and fulfill Old Testament prophecy
Miracles were common and expected of all rabbis
Miracles were viewed negatively and led to rejection
Miracles were not recorded in Jewish texts
questions.correctAnswer: Miracles authenticate Jesus as the promised Messiah and fulfill Old Testament prophecy
questions.explanation: Healing diseases like leprosy, often seen as divine punishment, signaled Jesus’ messianic role and fulfillment of Isaiah’s prophecies (Matthew 8:2-3, 17).

questions.question: True or False: The narrative of the two demon-possessed men in Matthew 8:28-34 ends with the city’s people welcoming Jesus and supporting His ministry.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The city’s people, after hearing about the event, asked Jesus to leave their region, showing rejection rather than welcome (Matthew 8:34).

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 8 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 8 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What does the healing of the leper in Matthew 8:2-3 primarily demonstrate about Jesus' divine authority?
options: His power to cleanse sin and disease
His role as a political leader
His ability to perform miracles only through intermediaries
His focus on ritual purity laws
questions.correctAnswer: His power to cleanse sin and disease
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:2-3 shows Jesus healing a leper by his own touch, indicating his authority over sickness and impurity, which symbolizes sin. This is consistent with Isaiah 53:4, Psalm 103:3, and Luke 5:12-13, where healing is linked to the Messiah's mission to bear infirmities and sin.

questions.question: In Matthew 8:8-10, what theological truth is emphasized through the centurion's understanding of authority?
options: Faith requires recognizing Jesus' sovereign spiritual authority
Only physical presence can effect healing
Authority is irrelevant in the kingdom of God
Faith is primarily about works and rituals
questions.correctAnswer: Faith requires recognizing Jesus' sovereign spiritual authority
questions.explanation: The centurion acknowledges Jesus' authority to heal by speaking a word, demonstrating a profound faith in Jesus’ divine power. This reflects themes in John 5:19, Hebrews 1:3, and Romans 13:1 about divine authority governing creation and salvation.

questions.question: What eschatological reality does Jesus reveal in Matthew 8:11-12 regarding the kingdom of heaven?
options: Gentiles will join the patriarchs in the kingdom, while some Jews will be excluded
Only Jews will enter the kingdom of heaven
The kingdom is a purely earthly political realm
All who call themselves children of God will enter without judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Gentiles will join the patriarchs in the kingdom, while some Jews will be excluded
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that many from east and west will join Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, showing inclusion of Gentiles (Matthew 8:11), while some 'children of the kingdom' will be cast out (8:12). This aligns with Isaiah 56:6-7, Romans 11:25-27, and Revelation 21:24-27 on the inclusion of Gentiles and judgment.

questions.question: What doctrine about Jesus’ identity is implicit when the demons recognize Him as 'Son of God' in Matthew 8:29?
options: Jesus possesses divine sonship and authority over evil
Jesus is merely a prophet with limited power
Jesus is an angelic being
Jesus is a political revolutionary
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus possesses divine sonship and authority over evil
questions.explanation: The demons confess Jesus as 'Son of God' (Matthew 8:29), affirming His divine identity and authority over spiritual forces, consistent with John 1:34, Hebrews 1:5-8, and Philippians 2:9-11, which highlight His divine nature and lordship.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ command to the disciples to 'let the dead bury their dead' in Matthew 8:22 illustrate the call to discipleship?
options: It prioritizes spiritual commitment over social or familial obligations
It emphasizes the importance of proper burial rites
It encourages delaying discipleship until family duties are complete
It promotes cultural traditions above the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: It prioritizes spiritual commitment over social or familial obligations
questions.explanation: Jesus’ statement in Matthew 8:22 underscores that following Him requires radical commitment, even above cultural and familial duties. This theme aligns with Luke 14:26-27, Mark 8:34, and Philippians 3:8, emphasizing the cost and priority of discipleship.

questions.question: What theological significance does Jesus’ rebuke of the sea and wind in Matthew 8:26 demonstrate?
options: Jesus has sovereign authority over nature, affirming His divine power
Natural disasters are unrelated to spiritual matters
Jesus cannot control nature without help
Fear of nature is justified despite faith
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus has sovereign authority over nature, affirming His divine power
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:26, Jesus rebukes the storm, calming it instantly. This reveals His divine sovereignty over creation, as seen in Psalm 107:29, Job 38, and Mark 4:39, confirming His identity as Creator and Lord over all.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ instruction to the healed leper to show himself to the priest and offer the gift prescribed by Moses in Matthew 8:4 reveal about Jesus’ relationship to the Law?
options: Jesus fulfills the Law and respects its ordinances
Jesus abolishes the Law entirely
Jesus disregards Jewish Law and tradition
Jesus replaces the Law with new human traditions
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus fulfills the Law and respects its ordinances
questions.explanation: Jesus commands the leper to follow Mosaic Law rituals (Matthew 8:4), showing His fulfillment of the Law, not abolition (Matthew 5:17-18). This respects the Old Testament Law (Leviticus 14) and points to the continuity of God’s redemptive plan.

questions.question: According to Matthew 8:17, how is Jesus’ healing ministry related to Old Testament prophecy?
options: It fulfills Isaiah’s prophecy that the Messiah would bear infirmities and sicknesses
It contradicts Old Testament teachings on suffering
It is unrelated to prophetic fulfillment
It demonstrates a new covenant without prophetic foundation
questions.correctAnswer: It fulfills Isaiah’s prophecy that the Messiah would bear infirmities and sicknesses
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:17 cites Isaiah 53:4 to show Jesus’ healing acts fulfill prophecy about the suffering Servant who bears our sickness and infirmities, confirming God’s redemptive plan through Christ’s atoning work.

questions.question: What core Christian doctrine is illustrated by Jesus healing the centurion’s servant 'at the same hour' in Matthew 8:13?
options: The immediacy of divine grace and power through faith
Salvation requires prolonged rituals
Healing is only symbolic and delayed
Faith has no role in receiving God’s blessings
questions.correctAnswer: The immediacy of divine grace and power through faith
questions.explanation: The servant’s immediate healing upon the centurion’s faith (Matthew 8:13) illustrates that divine grace operates powerfully and instantly when accessed by faith, consistent with Hebrews 11:1, Ephesians 2:8-9, and John 3:16.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ statement about having 'not where to lay his head' in Matthew 8:20 teach about His earthly mission?
options: Jesus embraced a life of humility and poverty in His earthly ministry
Jesus sought earthly wealth and comfort
Jesus avoided hardship by staying in comfortable homes
Jesus prioritized political power over personal sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus embraced a life of humility and poverty in His earthly ministry
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:20 shows Jesus’ voluntary acceptance of a humble, itinerant lifestyle, fulfilling prophetic themes from Isaiah 53:3 and Psalm 22:6, highlighting His identification with human suffering and rejection.

questions.question: How does the reaction of the people after the swine incident in Matthew 8:33-34 illustrate a tension in Jesus’ ministry?
options: Fear of Jesus’ authority led some to reject Him despite His power to save
Everyone immediately accepted Jesus as Messiah
The people were indifferent to spiritual matters
They celebrated the financial gain from the miracle
questions.correctAnswer: Fear of Jesus’ authority led some to reject Him despite His power to save
questions.explanation: Matthew 8:33-34 records fear and rejection by the townsfolk after Jesus cast out demons, highlighting the paradox that divine power can provoke both faith and fear, consistent with John 1:11 and Luke 19:41-44.

questions.question: What doctrinal truth about faith is taught by Jesus marveling at the centurion’s faith in Matthew 8:10?
options: Faith is essential for receiving God's healing and salvation
Faith is unnecessary for miracles
Only Jews can have genuine faith
Faith is based on human works
questions.correctAnswer: Faith is essential for receiving God's healing and salvation
questions.explanation: Jesus’ marvel at the centurion’s faith (Matthew 8:10) reveals faith as the key condition for receiving God’s blessings, consistent with Romans 4:20-21, Hebrews 11:6, and Ephesians 2:8.

questions.question: How does the healing of Peter’s mother-in-law in Matthew 8:14-15 demonstrate Jesus’ compassion and authority?
options: Jesus heals by touch, restoring her to service, showing His power and care
Jesus requires elaborate rituals before healing
Jesus only heals after long prayers
Jesus demands payment for healing
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus heals by touch, restoring her to service, showing His power and care
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:14-15, Jesus’ immediate healing by touch and her subsequent service illustrate His compassionate authority, fulfilling messianic expectations of restoration (Isaiah 61:1-3).

questions.question: In Matthew 8:18-22, what does Jesus’ response to the scribe and disciple teach about the cost of following Him?
options: Following Jesus requires total commitment, often at great personal cost
Following Jesus is easy and without sacrifice
Discipleship depends on social status
Following Jesus involves political gain
questions.correctAnswer: Following Jesus requires total commitment, often at great personal cost
questions.explanation: Jesus’ responses in Matthew 8:18-22 emphasize that discipleship demands complete surrender, aligning with Luke 9:23-24, Mark 10:29-30, and Philippians 3:7-8.

questions.question: What Christological truth is reflected in Jesus casting out demons with his word in Matthew 8:16?
options: Jesus’ spoken word reveals His divine authority over spiritual powers
Jesus requires magical rituals for exorcism
Demons have no recognition of Jesus’ authority
Jesus’ power is limited to healing physical sickness
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus’ spoken word reveals His divine authority over spiritual powers
questions.explanation: In Matthew 8:16, Jesus casts out demons by speaking, demonstrating His divine authority over evil spirits, as supported by Luke 4:36, Mark 1:27, and Colossians 2:15.
